rows.mepc_reference: MEPC.379 Page 44, Example of the Inventory for existing ships (Particulars)
rows.ihm_output: Page 1-4 lack required fields for Port of registry, Type of vessel, Gross tonnage, Name of shipbuilder, Distinctive number/letters, and Date of delivery. Only IMO number (9083081) and Ship Name (MV GREAT ROYAL) are present.
rows.remarks: Essential ship particulars required by the standard IHM format (MEPC.379, Appendix 4, and Example Format) are missing from the introductory section reviewed.

rows.mepc_reference: MEPC.379 Page 44, Example of the Inventory for existing ships (Development Statement)
rows.ihm_output: The statement 'This inventory was developed in accordance with the guidelines for the development of the Inventory of Hazardous Materials' is missing from Pages 1-4.
rows.remarks: The mandatory declaration confirming compliance with the guidelines for IHM development is absent from the introductory pages.

rows.mepc_reference: MEPC.379 Page 17/19, Standard Format of the Inventory (Parts I, II, III)
rows.ihm_output: Page 2 lists headings for Part-II (Page 9), Part-III (Page 10), and Step-5 Preparation of Part 1 (Page 96).
rows.remarks: The Table of Contents confirms that all three required parts (I, II, and III) are structurally included in the report.

rows.mepc_reference: MEPC.379 Page 6, Section 4.1.4 (Process for checking of materials)
rows.ihm_output: Page 2 lists Appendix – 9 Material Declaration (MD) : 197 and Appendix – 10 Supplier's Declaration of Conformity (SDoC) : 198.
rows.remarks: The TOC confirms the inclusion of Material Declarations (MDs) and SDoCs, fulfilling the requirement that material checking should be based on supplier documentation.

rows.ihm_output: Page 2 lists 'Step-2 Assessment of collected information...' (Page 29) and 'Step-5 Preparation of Part 1 of HazMat Inventory...' (Page 96).
rows.remarks: The report structure includes dedicated sections for the Assessment (Attachment 2) and the final Inventory (Attachment 1).
